meanings.definition: A level of rank, quality, proficiency, or value
meanings.sent1: She reached the highest grade in her class.
meanings.sent2: The store sells products of different grades.
meanings.sent3: The cake was of such high grade that it disappeared in minutes!
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was of the highest grade.
meanings.sent5: The diamond sparkled with the brilliance of top grade quality.

meanings.definition: A mark indicating the quality of a student's work
meanings.sent1: Her test paper had a perfect grade at the top.
meanings.sent2: The teacher gave him a good grade for his project.
meanings.sent3: The cat received a grade for its impressive nap skills.
meanings.sent4: The grade on his essay reflected his hard work.
meanings.sent5: The grade on the painting showed the artist's talent.

meanings.sent1: The road had a steep grade that made it hard to climb.
meanings.sent2: The skiers enjoyed the gentle grade of the hill.
meanings.sent3: The grade of the hill made it perfect for rolling down.
meanings.sent4: The grade of the slide made it thrilling for the kids.
meanings.sent5: The grade of the path led them to the beautiful view.

meanings.definition: A degree of inclination or decline
meanings.sent1: The ship had to navigate through a steep grade in the river.
meanings.sent2: The hiker struggled with the steep grade of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The grade of the hill made it a fun challenge to climb.
meanings.sent4: The grade of the road made it difficult for the cyclists.
meanings.sent5: The grade of the slope tested their endurance and determination.
